alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Gila Bend; North Phoenix, Glendale; Northwest Pinal County; Northwest Valley; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; South Mountain, Ahwatukee; Tonopah Desert; West Pinal County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 4:19PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 515 PM MST... At 419 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking several strong thunderstorms across Western Maricopa and Pinal Counties. These storms are moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Glendale, Surprise, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, El Mirage, Tolleson, Gila Bend, Tonopah, Waddell, Cashion, Wittmann, Sun City West, Maricopa, Estrella, Litchfield Park, Palo Verde, White Tank Mountain Park, Big Horn and Cotton Center. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 80 and 134. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 109 and 156. US Highway 60 between mile markers 126 and 141. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
